171.sentence: So the pretty solid router all around good for the money  here's the link to firmware updates http://www.sveasoft.com/forum6.html

172.sentence: Absolutely no problems with this router.

173.sentence: I downloaded and updated the firmware, and followed the easy setup instructions.

174.sentence: A call to customer support (got to a live person within a couple of minutes) helped me tweak a couple of the settings to streamline performance.

176.sentence: After upgrading the drivers and firmware a few times and e-mailing tech support for some setting tips it now works fine.

177.sentence: As far as Linksys goes, I have used several of their products and they seem to hold up well - no problems.

178.sentence: Getting the router setup in a "vanilla" configuration that works for 99% of users was very easy, and I was able to do this no problem.

179.sentence: Second, the setup CD actually worked perfectly.

180.sentence: I still need to read up on some of the security settings, etc to fully understand all that's up there, but bottom-line is that the installation was like night and day compared to the Speedboost router.

181.sentence: The performance of the router itself deserves 5 stars, but the Linksys documentation and support is so poor that I can only give it 4.

182.sentence: Even the PDF manual that comes with it is pretty vague for someone not familiar with "MAC settings", etc.

183.sentence: When I saw a high gain (low price) antenna was available to the WRT54G router, I thought I'd happily give up some (practically unattainable anyway, since you've got to be in spitting distance from the router) speed in favour of wider coverage.

184.sentence: Having done all this, I was quite pleased to see that all corners I needed were decently covered by the signal.

185.sentence: The box is upstairs, and in the farthest room I get connected at 11-18M speed - that is similar to the older 10M ethernet standard.

186.sentence: Apart from speed, the signal is consistent and works without interruptions, etc.

187.sentence: the WRT54G plus the HGA7T is a perfect solution if you need wireless coverage in a wider area or for a hard-walled house as was my case.

188.sentence: We bought this about 6 months ago and it's been worthless.

189.sentence: It constantly drops the internet connection and simple things like WALLS in our house block the link so everything is very slow.

190.sentence: The tech support is worthless too.
